bug.author: cchadowitz-pf
bug.summary: OpenImages TF model update to use a sigmoid instead of softmax layer
bug.description:
Based on a long series of discussion with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/beniz>@beniz</denchmark-link> , I managed to produce a model file based on the original OpenImages Inception v3 model that works with DeepDetect and outputs confidences from a sigmoid layer (as the original model used) rather than a softmax. A lot of info was inspired by this comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/openimages/dataset/issues/21#issuecomment-276107322>openimages/dataset#21 (comment)</denchmark-link>
and other helpful information from: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/openimages/dataset/issues/3#issuecomment-259552328>openimages/dataset#3 (comment)</denchmark-link>
A very rough how-to is available here: <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/cchadowitz-pf/f1c3e781c125813f9976f6e69c06fec2>https://gist.github.com/cchadowitz-pf/f1c3e781c125813f9976f6e69c06fec2</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Thank you, I've checked the model and it appears to work very nicely. Model link has been updated.
